name: 21s Bicep Curl
instructions: Perform 7 reps from bottom to midpoint of curl
Perform 7 reps from midpoint to top of curl
Finish with 7 full range of motion reps
tips: Keep your elbows stationary throughout all three phases for maximum bicep engagement

name: Ab Scissors
instructions: Lie on your back with legs extended and hands under glutes
Lift both legs slightly off the ground
Alternate crossing one leg over the other in a scissoring motion
Keep core engaged and lower back pressed to floor
tips: Keep movements controlled and avoid letting your lower back arch off the ground

name: Ab Wheel
instructions: Kneel on the floor holding the ab wheel handles
Roll the wheel forward while keeping your core braced
Extend as far as possible while maintaining control
Roll back to starting position using your core
tips: Start with shorter rolls and gradually increase range as you build core strength

name: Aerobics
instructions: Perform rhythmic cardiovascular movements
Include movements like jumping, stepping, and arm work
Maintain steady pace throughout session
tips: Keep intensity at a level where you can maintain conversation for optimal fat burning

name: Air Bike
instructions: Lie on your back with hands behind head
Bring opposite elbow to opposite knee in a cycling motion
Extend the other leg straight out
Alternate sides in a continuous pedaling motion
tips: Focus on rotating your torso rather than pulling on your neck

name: Arnold Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Start with dumbbells at shoulder height, palms facing you
Press upward while rotating palms to face forward
Fully extend arms overhead
Reverse the motion to return to start
tips: The rotation engages more shoulder fibers than a standard press

name: Around The World
instructions: Lie on bench holding one dumbbell with both hands above chest
Keep slight bend in elbows and move weight in wide arc
Circle the weight around your head in complete circle
Maintain constant tension throughout movement
tips: Use lighter weight than typical chest exercises due to extended range of motion

name: Assisted Pistol Squats
instructions: Stand on one leg holding onto support for balance
Extend other leg straight in front
Lower down into squat while keeping extended leg off ground
Push through heel to return to standing
tips: Focus on keeping your knee tracking over your toes throughout the movement

name: Back Extension (Hyperextension)
instructions: Position yourself on hyperextension bench with ankles secured
Start with torso bent forward at waist
Raise torso until body forms straight line
Lower back down with control
tips: Avoid hyperextending past parallel to prevent lower back strain

name: Back Extension (Machine)
instructions: Adjust machine and position yourself with pad against lower back
Start in flexed position
Push against pad to extend spine to neutral
Return to starting position with control
tips: Focus on controlled movements rather than using momentum

name: Back Extension (Weighted Hyperextension)
instructions: Position yourself on hyperextension bench holding weight to chest
Start with torso bent forward
Raise torso to form straight line
Lower back down maintaining control of weight
tips: Start with light weight and focus on form before progressing load

name: Ball Slams
instructions: Hold medicine ball overhead with arms extended
Engage core and slam ball down to ground explosively
Catch ball on bounce or pick up
Return to overhead position and repeat
tips: Use your whole body in the slam, not just your arms, for maximum power

name: Band Pullaparts
instructions: Hold resistance band at chest height with arms extended
Pull band apart by moving hands outward
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end position
Return to starting position with control
tips: Keep your arms straight throughout the movement to isolate the rear delts

name: Battle Ropes
instructions: Hold one end of rope in each hand with slight bend in knees
Create alternating waves by moving arms up and down
Maintain steady rhythm and pace
Keep core engaged throughout
tips: Focus on speed and consistency rather than creating large waves

name: Behind the Back Bicep Wrist Curl (Barbell)
instructions: Stand holding barbell behind back with palms facing away
Let wrists flex downward
Curl wrists upward to flex forearms
Lower back to starting position
tips: Use lighter weight and focus on full range of motion in the wrists

name: Behind the Back Curl (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing away from low cable pulley
Grab handle behind your back with underhand grip
Curl weight forward keeping elbow stationary
Lower with control and repeat
tips: This variation provides constant tension throughout the entire range of motion

name: Belt Squat (Machine)
instructions: Secure belt around waist and attach to machine
Stand on platform with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down by bending knees and hips
Push through heels to return to standing
tips: Belt squats reduce spinal loading while maintaining leg training intensity

name: Bench Dip
instructions: Place hands on edge of bench behind you, legs extended forward
Lower body by bending elbows to 90 degrees
Keep elbows pointing back, not flared out
Push back up to starting position
tips: Keep your hips close to the bench to maintain proper form and shoulder safety

name: Bench Press (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on bench with feet flat on floor and grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
Unrack bar and position over chest with arms extended
Lower bar to mid-chest with control
Press bar up until arms are fully extended
tips: Retract your shoulder blades and maintain a slight arch in your lower back for stability

name: Bench Press (Cable)
instructions: Position bench between two cable stations at chest height
Lie on bench and grab both handles
Press handles up and together above chest
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Cable variation provides constant tension throughout the entire movement

name: Bench Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on bench holding dumbbells at chest level
Press dumbbells up until arms are fully extended
Lower dumbbells with control to chest level
Maintain neutral wrist position throughout
tips: Dumbbells allow for greater range of motion and help address strength imbalances

name: Bench Press (Smith Machine)
instructions: Lie on bench positioned under smith machine bar
Unrack bar and position over chest
Lower bar to chest with control
Press up until arms fully extended and re-rack
tips: Smith machine provides stability, allowing you to focus purely on pressing movement

name: Bench Press - Close Grip (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on bench and grip bar with hands shoulder-width or closer
Unrack and position bar over chest
Lower bar to lower chest keeping elbows tucked
Press back up to full arm extension
tips: Keep elbows closer to body to maximize triceps engagement

name: Bench Press - Wide Grip (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on bench and grip bar wider than standard grip
Unrack bar and position over chest
Lower to chest with elbows flared slightly
Press back up explosively
tips: Wide grip emphasizes outer chest but may increase shoulder stress

name: Bent Over Row (Band)
instructions: Stand on band with feet shoulder-width apart
Bend forward at hips keeping back straight
Pull band handles to sides of torso
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep your core tight and avoid rounding your back throughout the movement

name: Bent Over Row (Barbell)
instructions: Hold barbell with overhand grip, bend at hips
Keep back straight and core braced
Pull bar to lower chest/upper abdomen
Lower weight with control
tips: Maintain a neutral spine and avoid using momentum to lift the weight

name: Bent Over Row (Dumbbell)
instructions: Bend forward at hips holding dumbbells with arms extended
Keep back flat and core engaged
Pull dumbbells to sides of torso
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Focus on squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top of each rep

name: Bicep Curl (Barbell)
instructions: Stand holding barbell with underhand grip, arms fully extended
Keep elbows close to sides
Curl weight up toward shoulders
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Avoid swinging or using momentum - keep your upper arms stationary

name: Bicep Curl (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable machine with low pulley attachment
Grab handle with underhand grip
Curl weight toward shoulder keeping elbow stationary
Lower with control
tips: Cable provides constant tension which can enhance muscle growth

name: Bicep Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides with palms forward
Keep elbows close to torso
Curl weights toward shoulders
Lower with control to starting position
tips: You can alternate arms or curl both together - both variations are effective

name: Bicep Curl (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine and position arms on pad
Grip handles with underhand grip
Curl weight toward shoulders
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Machine curl stabilizes your position for maximum bicep isolation

name: Bicep Curl (Suspension)
instructions: Hold suspension handles and lean back with arms extended
Keep body straight from head to heels
Curl body up by bending elbows
Lower back down with control
tips: Adjust difficulty by changing your body angle - more horizontal is harder

name: Bicycle Crunch
instructions: Lie on back with hands behind head
Bring opposite elbow to opposite knee
Extend other leg straight
Alternate sides in cycling motion
tips: Focus on quality rotations rather than speed for better core engagement

name: Bicycle Crunch Raised Legs
instructions: Lie on back with legs raised and hands behind head
Keep legs elevated throughout movement
Bring opposite elbow to opposite knee
Alternate sides in controlled motion
tips: Keeping legs elevated increases difficulty and core engagement

name: Bird Dog
instructions: Start on hands and knees in tabletop position
Extend opposite arm and leg simultaneously
Hold briefly maintaining balance
Return to start and switch sides
tips: Keep your hips level and core engaged throughout to maximize stability benefits

name: Box Jump
instructions: Stand facing box at appropriate height
Swing arms and jump explosively onto box
Land softly with both feet on box
Step down and reset for next rep
tips: Focus on soft landings to reduce joint impact and improve control

name: Box Squat (Barbell)
instructions: Set up barbell on back and stand in front of box
Squat down until sitting on box
Pause briefly on box
Drive through heels to stand back up
tips: Box squats help develop explosive power from the bottom position

name: Boxing
instructions: Maintain boxing stance with hands up
Throw combination of punches
Keep moving and maintain form
Include defensive movements
tips: Focus on technique and breathing rhythm for sustained performance

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
instructions: Place rear foot elevated on bench behind you
Stand on front leg with good posture
Lower down by bending front knee
Push through front heel to return to start
tips: Keep torso upright and ensure front knee tracks over toes

name: Burpee
instructions: Start standing then drop to squat position
Place hands on ground and jump feet back to plank
Perform push-up then jump feet back to hands
Jump up explosively with arms overhead
tips: Maintain a steady pace to maximize cardiovascular benefits

name: Burpee Over the Bar
instructions: Perform standard burpee next to barbell
After standing up, jump laterally over bar
Land and immediately start next burpee
Continue alternating sides
tips: Focus on controlled landings to prevent injury during lateral jumps

name: Butterfly (Pec Deck)
instructions: Sit at machine with back against pad
Place forearms on pads with elbows at shoulder height
Bring arms together in front of chest
Return to starting position with control
tips: Focus on squeezing chest muscles together at the peak contraction

name: Cable Core Palloff Press
instructions: Stand sideways to cable machine at chest height
Hold handle at chest with both hands
Press arms straight out resisting rotation
Return to chest and repeat
tips: Keep your hips square and resist the pull trying to rotate your torso

name: Cable Crunch
instructions: Kneel facing cable machine with rope attachment overhead
Hold rope beside head
Crunch down bringing elbows toward knees
Return to starting position with control
tips: Focus on curling your spine rather than just pulling with your arms

name: Cable Fly Crossovers
instructions: Stand between two cable stations set at shoulder height
Hold handles with arms extended to sides
Bring hands together in front of chest
Return to starting position with control
tips: Maintain slight bend in elbows throughout and focus on chest squeeze

name: Cable Pull Through
instructions: Face away from low cable with rope between legs
Hinge at hips and reach back to grab rope
Drive hips forward to stand up
Squeeze glutes at top then return to start
tips: Focus on hip hinge movement pattern rather than squatting

name: Cable Twist (Down to up)
instructions: Stand sideways to cable at low position
Grab handle with both hands
Rotate and lift cable across body to opposite shoulder
Return with control and repeat
tips: Let rotation come from your core, not just your arms

name: Cable Twist (Up to down)
instructions: Stand sideways to cable at high position
Grab handle with both hands overhead
Rotate and bring cable down across body
Return to start with control
tips: Keep your hips stable and generate movement from your core

name: Calf Extension (Machine)
instructions: Position yourself in calf machine with shoulders under pads
Place balls of feet on platform
Rise up onto toes as high as possible
Lower heels below platform level
tips: Full range of motion is crucial for calf development

name: Calf Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit in leg press machine with balls of feet on platform
Extend ankles to push platform away
Lower heels to stretch calves
Press back up through balls of feet
tips: Control the negative portion for better muscle development

name: Chest Dip
instructions: Grip dip bars and support body with arms extended
Lean forward and lower body by bending elbows
Go down until shoulders are below elbows
Push back up to starting position
tips: Lean forward more to emphasize chest over triceps

name: Chest Dip (Assisted)
instructions: Set assistance weight on machine
Grip handles and place knees on pad
Lower body by bending elbows with forward lean
Push back up to full arm extension
tips: Reduce assistance weight progressively to build strength for unassisted dips

name: Chest Dip (Weighted)
instructions: Attach weight to dip belt around waist
Grip dip bars with arms extended
Lean forward and lower body with control
Push back up to starting position
tips: Master bodyweight dips before adding external weight

name: Chest Fly (Band)
instructions: Anchor band behind you at chest height
Hold ends with arms extended to sides
Bring hands together in front of chest
Return to starting position with control
tips: Maintain slight elbow bend throughout movement

name: Chest Fly (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on bench holding dumbbells above chest
Lower dumbbells out to sides with slight elbow bend
Bring dumbbells back together above chest
Squeeze chest at top of movement
tips: Keep elbows slightly bent throughout to protect shoulder joints

name: Chest Fly (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with back against pad
Grip handles with arms extended to sides
Bring handles together in front of chest
Return to starting position with control
tips: Focus on using chest muscles rather than pushing with arms

name: Chest Fly (Suspension)
instructions: Face away from anchor with handles in hands
Lean forward with arms extended to sides
Bring hands together in front of chest
Return to starting position with control
tips: Body angle determines difficulty - more horizontal is harder

name: Chest Press (Band)
instructions: Anchor band behind you at chest height
Hold handles at chest level
Press forward until arms fully extended
Return to starting position with control
tips: Step forward to increase tension and difficulty

name: Chest Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with back against pad
Grip handles at chest height
Press handles forward until arms extended
Return to starting position with control
tips: Adjust seat so handles align with mid-chest level

name: Chest Supported Incline Row (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie face down on incline bench holding dumbbells
Let arms hang straight down
Pull dumbbells to sides of torso
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Chest support eliminates momentum and isolates back muscles

name: Chest Supported Reverse Fly (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie face down on incline bench with dumbbells
Keep slight bend in elbows
Raise arms out to sides in reverse fly motion
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Focus on squeezing shoulder blades together at top of movement

name: Chest Supported Y Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie face down on incline bench with dumbbells
Raise arms forward and out forming Y shape
Lift to shoulder level
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Use lighter weight and focus on control and proper form

name: Chin Up
instructions: Hang from bar with underhand grip shoulder-width apart
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full arm extension
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Chin-ups emphasize biceps more than overhand pull-ups

name: Chin Up (Assisted)
instructions: Set assistance weight on machine
Grip bar with underhand grip
Pull body up with assistance until chin clears bar
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Gradually reduce assistance to build strength for unassisted chin-ups

name: Chin Up (Weighted)
instructions: Attach weight to dip belt
Hang from bar with underhand grip
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Only add weight once you can perform multiple clean bodyweight reps

name: Clamshell
instructions: Lie on side with knees bent and feet together
Raise top knee while keeping feet touching
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep hips stacked and avoid rotating backwards during movement

name: Clap Push Ups
instructions: Start in push-up position
Lower down then explode up with enough force to clap
Clap hands quickly in air
Land with control and repeat
tips: Build explosive power with standard push-ups before attempting clap variations

name: Clean
instructions: Start with barbell on floor, grip outside knees
Explosively pull bar up while extending hips and knees
Drop under bar catching it on front shoulders
Stand fully upright to complete lift
tips: Focus on explosive hip extension and quick drop under the bar

name: Clean and Jerk
instructions: Perform clean to catch bar on front shoulders
Dip slightly then drive bar overhead
Split or squat under bar as needed
Stand fully upright with bar overhead
tips: Master the clean before adding the jerk component

name: Clean and Press
instructions: Clean barbell to front shoulders
Press bar overhead using shoulder press
Lower bar to shoulders then to floor
Reset and repeat
tips: Combination movement builds full body power and strength

name: Clean Pull
instructions: Start with barbell on floor in clean grip
Pull bar explosively to chest height
Extend hips and rise onto toes
Lower bar with control to starting position
tips: Focus on explosive hip extension without catching the bar

name: Climbing
instructions: Grip holds with hands and place feet on wall
Plan route and make controlled movements upward
Use legs to push rather than just pulling with arms
Maintain three points of contact for stability
tips: Focus on technique and footwork to conserve upper body strength

name: Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit on bench with elbow braced against inner thigh
Hold dumbbell with arm fully extended
Curl weight toward shoulder
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Bracing eliminates momentum for strict bicep isolation

name: Cross Body Hammer Curl
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells with neutral grip
Curl one weight across body toward opposite shoulder
Keep elbow stationary throughout
Lower and repeat on other side
tips: This angle emphasizes the brachialis for fuller arm development

name: Crunch
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent and feet flat
Place hands behind head or across chest
Lift shoulder blades off ground by contracting abs
Lower back down with control
tips: Focus on curling your ribcage toward pelvis rather than just lifting up

name: Crunch (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with pads positioned on chest
Grip handles and brace core
Crunch forward using abdominal muscles
Return to starting position with control
tips: Machine allows for progressive overload in core training

name: Crunch (Weighted)
instructions: Lie on back holding weight plate on chest
Perform crunch bringing shoulder blades off ground
Keep weight secure on chest throughout
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Start with light weight to master form before progressing load

name: Curtsy Lunge (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides
Step one leg back and across behind other leg
Lower into lunge position
Push through front heel to return to start
tips: This variation emphasizes glute medius more than standard lunges

name: Cycling
instructions: Adjust bike seat to proper height
Maintain steady pedaling cadence
Adjust resistance as needed for intensity
Keep upper body relaxed while pedaling
tips: Maintain 80-100 RPM cadence for optimal cardiovascular training

name: Dead Bug
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended toward ceiling
Raise knees to 90-degree angle
Lower opposite arm and leg simultaneously
Return to start and alternate sides
tips: Press lower back into floor throughout to protect spine

name: Dead Hang
instructions: Grip pull-up bar with both hands
Hang with arms fully extended
Keep shoulders engaged and body straight
Hold position for desired time
tips: Dead hangs improve grip strength and shoulder health

name: Deadlift (Band)
instructions: Stand on band with feet hip-width apart
Hold band ends with straight arms
Hinge at hips and lower torso
Drive through heels to stand upright
tips: Keep back flat and core engaged throughout movement

name: Deadlift (Barbell)
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, bar over mid-foot
Grip bar outside legs with straight arms
Lift by extending hips and knees together
Stand fully upright then lower with control
tips: Keep the bar close to your body throughout the entire movement

name: Deadlift (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides
Hinge at hips keeping back straight
Lower dumbbells along legs
Drive through heels to return upright
tips: Dumbbells allow for more natural grip position and movement path

name: Deadlift (Smith Machine)
instructions: Position bar at shin height on smith machine
Stand with feet hip-width apart under bar
Grip bar and lift by extending hips and knees
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Fixed bar path can help beginners learn proper form

name: Deadlift (Trap bar)
instructions: Step inside trap bar with feet hip-width apart
Grip handles at sides
Lift by extending hips and knees
Stand fully upright then lower with control
tips: Trap bar reduces lower back stress and allows more upright position

name: Deadlift High Pull
instructions: Perform deadlift movement to hip level
Continue pulling bar up to chest height
Rise onto toes at top of pull
Lower bar with control to ground
tips: Focus on explosive hip extension to generate power

name: Decline Bench Press (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on decline bench with feet secured
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
Lower bar to lower chest
Press up to full arm extension
tips: Decline angle emphasizes lower chest development

name: Decline Bench Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on decline bench holding dumbbells
Start with dumbbells at chest level
Press dumbbells up until arms extended
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Greater range of motion than barbell version

name: Decline Bench Press (Machine)
instructions: Adjust seat on decline press machine
Grip handles at chest level
Press handles forward until arms extended
Return with control to starting position
tips: Machine provides stable pressing path for focused chest work

name: Decline Bench Press (Smith Machine)
instructions: Position decline bench under smith machine bar
Lie down and grip bar at chest width
Lower bar to lower chest
Press up to full extension and re-rack
tips: Fixed bar path allows for heavier loading with reduced stabilization needs

name: Decline Chest Fly (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on decline bench with dumbbells above chest
Lower dumbbells out to sides with slight elbow bend
Bring dumbbells back together above chest
Maintain controlled movement throughout
tips: Focus on stretch at bottom and squeeze at top

name: Decline Crunch
instructions: Lie on decline bench with feet secured
Place hands behind head
Crunch up bringing shoulder blades off bench
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Decline angle increases resistance and core engagement

name: Decline Crunch (Weighted)
instructions: Lie on decline bench holding weight on chest
Secure feet and brace core
Crunch up while keeping weight stable
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Combination of decline and weight provides significant challenge

name: Decline Push Up
instructions: Place feet on elevated surface in push-up position
Lower chest toward ground
Push back up to full arm extension
Maintain straight body line throughout
tips: Elevation increases difficulty and emphasizes upper chest

name: Diamond Push Up
instructions: Start in push-up position with hands together forming diamond
Lower chest toward hands
Push back up to full extension
Keep elbows close to body
tips: Close hand position maximally engages triceps

name: Downward Dog
instructions: Start on hands and knees
Lift hips up and back forming inverted V
Straighten legs and press heels toward floor
Hold position while breathing deeply
tips: Focus on lengthening spine rather than forcing heels down

name: Drag Curl
instructions: Stand holding barbell with underhand grip
Drag bar up body keeping elbows back
Bar stays in contact with torso
Lower with same dragging motion
tips: Unique bar path emphasizes bicep peak development

name: Dragon Flag
instructions: Lie on bench and grip bench behind head
Raise entire body up keeping it straight
Lower body slowly maintaining control
Stop before touching bench and repeat
tips: This is an advanced movement requiring significant core strength

name: Dragonfly
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended overhead gripping support
Raise legs and torso off ground
Hold body in straight line from shoulders to feet
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Similar to dragon flag, requires exceptional core control

name: Dumbbell Row
instructions: Place one knee and hand on bench for support
Hold dumbbell in opposite hand with arm extended
Pull dumbbell to side of torso
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep your back flat and pull with your back muscles, not just your arm

name: Dumbbell Snatch
instructions: Start with dumbbell on floor between feet
Explosively pull dumbbell up
Drop under dumbbell as it rises
Catch overhead with arm locked out
tips: Generate power from hips and legs, not just arms

name: Dumbbell Squeeze Press
instructions: Lie on bench holding dumbbells pressed together
Keep dumbbells squeezed together throughout
Press up until arms fully extended
Lower while maintaining squeeze
tips: Squeezing increases inner chest activation

name: Dumbbell Step Up
instructions: Stand facing box or platform holding dumbbells
Step up with one foot onto platform
Drive through heel to stand fully on box
Step down with control and alternate legs
tips: Avoid pushing off back foot - let front leg do the work

name: Elbow to Knee
instructions: Stand with hands behind head
Bring one knee up while bringing opposite elbow down
Touch elbow to knee
Return to start and alternate sides
tips: Focus on core contraction rather than just bringing limbs together

name: Elliptical Trainer
instructions: Step onto elliptical and grip handles
Begin moving feet in elliptical motion
Push and pull handles to engage upper body
Maintain steady pace throughout workout
tips: Low-impact option that still provides excellent cardiovascular workout

name: EZ Bar Biceps Curl
instructions: Stand holding EZ bar with underhand grip
Keep elbows at sides
Curl bar toward shoulders
Lower with control to full extension
tips: EZ bar reduces wrist strain compared to straight bar

name: Face Pull
instructions: Set cable at face height with rope attachment
Pull rope toward face
Separate ends of rope as they near face
Return with control to starting position
tips: Excellent for shoulder health and posture improvement

name: Farmers Walk
instructions: Hold heavy dumbbells or weights at sides
Stand tall with shoulders back
Walk forward maintaining posture
Keep core tight throughout
tips: Builds functional strength and grip endurance

name: Feet Up Bench Press (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on bench with feet elevated on bench
Grip bar at chest width
Lower bar to chest with extra control
Press back up maintaining stability
tips: Removing leg drive increases core stability demands

name: Fire Hydrants
instructions: Start on hands and knees
Lift one leg out to side keeping knee bent
Raise to hip height
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep hips level and avoid rotating torso during movement

name: Floor Press (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on floor with knees bent
Hold barbell above chest with arms extended
Lower bar until upper arms touch floor
Press back up to starting position
tips: Floor press reduces shoulder stress and emphasizes lockout strength

name: Floor Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on floor holding dumbbells above chest
Lower dumbbells until upper arms touch floor
Pause briefly on floor
Press back up to starting position
tips: Great for building pressing strength off the chest

name: Floor Triceps Dip
instructions: Sit on floor with hands behind you
Lift hips off ground
Bend elbows to lower hips toward floor
Press back up to starting position
tips: Keep elbows pointing back to maximize triceps engagement

name: Flutter Kicks
instructions: Lie on back with legs extended and hands under glutes
Lift legs slightly off ground
Alternate kicking legs up and down
Keep core engaged and back pressed down
tips: Small controlled kicks are more effective than large swings

name: Frog Jumps
instructions: Start in deep squat position
Jump forward explosively
Land back in squat position
Immediately jump again
tips: Focus on explosive power and soft landings

name: Frog Pumps (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on back with feet together and knees out
Place dumbbell on hips
Thrust hips up squeezing glutes
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Feet-together position provides unique glute activation

name: Front Lever Hold
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar
Raise body to horizontal position keeping it straight
Hold position with arms extended
Maintain control throughout hold
tips: This is an advanced movement requiring significant strength

name: Front Lever Raise
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar
Raise legs and torso to horizontal
Hold briefly in front lever position
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Build up to full front lever with tuck and advanced tuck progressions

name: Front Raise (Band)
instructions: Stand on band holding ends at sides
Raise arms straight forward to shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Avoid using momentum or swinging the weight up

name: Front Raise (Barbell)
instructions: Stand holding barbell at thighs
Raise bar forward to shoulder height
Keep arms straight with slight elbow bend
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Use lighter weight than you think - form is crucial

name: Front Raise (Cable)
instructions: Face away from low cable with handle in hands
Raise handle forward to shoulder height
Keep tension throughout movement
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout the movement

name: Front Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at thighs
Raise one or both arms forward to shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Can alternate arms or raise both together based on preference

name: Front Raise (Suspension)
instructions: Face anchor point holding handles
Lean back with arms extended forward
Raise body up by pulling handles up
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Adjust body angle to change difficulty level

name: Front Squat
instructions: Rest barbell on front shoulders in rack position
Keep elbows high and chest up
Squat down keeping torso upright
Drive through heels to stand back up
tips: Front squats require more core strength and upright posture than back squats

name: Full Squat
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down as deep as possible
Keep heels on ground and chest up
Drive through heels to stand back up
tips: Full depth squats maximize muscle engagement

name: Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent and feet flat
Drive through heels to lift hips up
Squeeze glutes at top
Lower hips with control and repeat
tips: Focus on glute contraction rather than arching your back

name: Glute Ham Raise
instructions: Position yourself in GHD machine
Lower torso toward floor with control
Use hamstrings to pull body back up
Maintain straight body line throughout
tips: One of the best exercises for hamstring strength and size

name: Glute Kickback (Machine)
instructions: Position yourself in glute kickback machine
Place one leg on pad
Push leg back extending at hip
Return with control and repeat
tips: Focus on squeezing glute at the top of movement

name: Glute Kickback on Floor
instructions: Start on hands and knees
Extend one leg back keeping knee bent
Lift heel toward ceiling
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep core engaged and avoid arching lower back

name: Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold dumbbell vertically at chest level
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down keeping chest up and elbows inside knees
Drive through heels to stand back up
tips: Excellent for learning proper squat form and depth

name: Good Morning (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell on upper back
Hinge at hips pushing butt back
Lower torso until nearly parallel to floor
Return to upright position
tips: Keep back flat and knees slightly bent throughout movement

name: Gorilla Row (Kettlebell)
instructions: Stand over two kettlebells in wide stance
Hinge at hips and grab both kettlebells
Row one kettlebell up while supporting with other arm
Alternate sides in explosive fashion
tips: Generate power from hips while maintaining core stability

name: Hack Squat
instructions: Hold barbell behind legs at arm's length
Squat down keeping chest up
Lower until thighs parallel to ground
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Behind the back position emphasizes quads

name: Hack Squat (Machine)
instructions: Position shoulders under pads on hack squat machine
Place feet on platform shoulder-width apart
Lower platform by bending knees
Push through heels to return to start
tips: Machine allows for heavy loading with reduced balance demands

name: Hammer Curl (Band)
instructions: Stand on band holding ends with neutral grip
Keep elbows at sides
Curl hands toward shoulders
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Neutral grip emphasizes brachialis for arm thickness

name: Hammer Curl (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with rope attachment at low setting
Grip rope with neutral grip
Curl rope toward shoulders keeping elbows stationary
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout range of motion

name: Hammer Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells with neutral grip (palms facing)
Keep elbows close to sides
Curl weights toward shoulders
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Hammer grip reduces stress on wrists while building arm size

name: Handstand Hold
instructions: Kick up into handstand against wall
Keep body straight and tight
Hold position maintaining balance
Focus on breathing throughout hold
tips: Build up time gradually and master against wall before freestanding

name: Handstand Push Up
instructions: Kick up into handstand against wall
Lower head toward ground
Press back up to full arm extension
Maintain control throughout
tips: Master handstand holds before attempting push-ups

name: Hang Clean
instructions: Start with bar at thigh level
Dip slightly then explosively extend hips
Pull bar up and drop under it
Catch bar on front shoulders in partial squat
tips: Focus on explosive hip extension and fast elbow turnover

name: Hang Snatch
instructions: Start with bar at thigh level with wide grip
Dip and explosively extend hips
Pull bar overhead while dropping under
Catch bar overhead in partial squat
tips: Requires significant mobility and explosive power

name: Hanging Knee Raise
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar with arms extended
Bring knees up toward chest
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Avoid swinging - use controlled movements for maximum core engagement

name: Hanging Leg Raise
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar
Raise straight legs up to horizontal or higher
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: More challenging than knee raises due to longer lever arm

name: Heel Taps
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent and feet flat
Lift shoulders off ground slightly
Reach hand to tap same side heel
Alternate sides in continuous motion
tips: Keep core engaged and shoulders off ground throughout

name: Hex Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on bench holding dumbbells pressed together
Press dumbbells up while keeping them squeezed together
Lower to chest maintaining squeeze
Press back up to starting position
tips: Similar to squeeze press, emphasizes inner chest

name: High Knee Skips
instructions: Skip forward bringing knees up high
Drive opposite arm forward with each skip
Land on balls of feet
Maintain quick rhythm
tips: Focus on height and power rather than distance

name: High Knees
instructions: Run in place bringing knees up high
Pump arms in running motion
Land on balls of feet
Maintain quick pace
tips: Great warm-up exercise that elevates heart rate quickly

name: HIIT
instructions: Alternate between high intensity intervals and rest periods
Choose exercises based on goals and equipment
Maintain maximum effort during work intervals
Use recovery periods to prepare for next interval
tips: HIIT maximizes calorie burn and improves cardiovascular fitness efficiently

name: Hiking
instructions: Walk on varied terrain at moderate to vigorous pace
Use trekking poles if available for added stability
Maintain steady breathing throughout
Take breaks as needed on longer hikes
tips: Hiking provides excellent cardiovascular workout while connecting with nature

name: Hip Abduction (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with pads against outer thighs
Push legs outward against resistance
Pause briefly at widest point
Return with control to starting position
tips: Important for hip stability and knee health

name: Hip Adduction (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with pads against inner thighs
Bring legs together against resistance
Pause briefly when legs are together
Return with control to starting position
tips: Balances hip abduction work for complete hip strength

name: Hip Thrust
instructions: Sit on ground with upper back against bench
Drive through heels to lift hips up
Squeeze glutes at top with knees at 90 degrees
Lower hips with control and repeat
tips: One of the most effective exercises for glute development

name: Hip Thrust (Barbell)
instructions: Sit with upper back against bench and barbell over hips
Drive through heels to thrust hips up
Squeeze glutes hard at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Use pad on barbell for comfort during heavy loading

name: Hip Thrust (Machine)
instructions: Position yourself in hip thrust machine
Place pad across hips
Drive hips up against resistance
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Machine provides stable and comfortable way to load glutes

name: Hip Thrust (Smith Machine)
instructions: Position bench under smith machine bar
Sit with upper back on bench and bar over hips
Thrust hips up to full extension
Lower with control and re-rack when complete
tips: Smith machine allows for easy setup and consistent bar path

name: Hollow Rock
instructions: Lie on back with arms extended overhead
Lift shoulders and legs off ground creating hollow position
Rock back and forth maintaining hollow position
Keep lower back pressed to floor
tips: Fundamental gymnastics position for core strength

name: Incline Bench Press (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on incline bench set to 30-45 degrees
Grip bar slightly wider than shoulders
Lower bar to upper chest
Press up to full arm extension
tips: Incline angle emphasizes upper chest and front deltoids

name: Incline Bench Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on incline bench holding dumbbells at chest level
Press dumbbells up until arms extended
Lower with control to chest level
Maintain neutral wrist position
tips: Dumbbells allow greater range of motion than barbell

name: Incline Bench Press (Smith Machine)
instructions: Position incline bench under smith machine
Unrack bar and lower to upper chest
Press up to full extension
Re-rack when set complete
tips: Fixed bar path provides stability for maximum loading

name: Incline Chest Fly (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on incline bench with dumbbells above chest
Lower dumbbells out to sides with slight elbow bend
Bring dumbbells back together above chest
Focus on chest squeeze at top
tips: Incline angle targets upper chest fibers

name: Incline Chest Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit at incline chest press machine
Grip handles at chest height
Press handles forward to full extension
Return with control to starting position
tips: Machine provides consistent resistance throughout movement

name: Incline Push Ups
instructions: Place hands on elevated surface in push-up position
Lower chest toward surface
Push back up to full arm extension
Maintain straight body line
tips: Easier variation good for building up to floor push-ups

name: Inverted Row
instructions: Lie under bar set at waist height
Grip bar with straight body
Pull chest to bar
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Bodyweight rowing exercise that builds pulling strength

name: Iso-Lateral Chest Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with independent handles
Press one or both handles forward
Extend arms fully
Return with control and repeat
tips: Independent handles allow you to work each side separately

name: Iso-Lateral High Row (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with chest against pad
Pull handles back toward upper chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control and repeat
tips: Targets upper back and rear delts effectively

name: Iso-Lateral Low Row
instructions: Sit at machine with chest against pad
Pull handles back toward lower chest
Focus on squeezing mid-back
Return with control and repeat
tips: Lower angle emphasizes lats and mid-back

name: Iso-Lateral Row (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with chest supported
Grip handles and pull back toward torso
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control to full extension
tips: Work both sides together or alternate for variety

name: Jack Knife (Suspension)
instructions: Start in plank with feet in suspension straps
Pull knees toward chest
Hold briefly in tucked position
Extend legs back to plank
tips: Challenging core exercise requiring significant control

name: Jackknife Sit Up
instructions: Lie flat with arms extended overhead
Simultaneously lift legs and torso to touch toes
Balance on glutes in V position
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Advanced movement requiring good core strength and control

name: JM Press (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on bench with bar at forehead level
Lower bar to forehead by bending elbows
Keep upper arms angled slightly
Press back up to starting position
tips: Hybrid between skull crusher and close grip bench press

name: Jump Rope
instructions: Hold rope handles at sides
Swing rope overhead and jump as it passes under feet
Land on balls of feet
Maintain steady rhythm
tips: Excellent cardiovascular exercise that improves coordination

name: Jump Shrug
instructions: Hold barbell at thighs
Jump explosively while shrugging shoulders
Rise onto toes at top
Land softly and reset
tips: Develops explosive power in posterior chain

name: Jump Squat
instructions: Start in quarter squat position
Jump up explosively
Land softly back in squat position
Immediately jump again
tips: Focus on explosive power and controlled landings

name: Jumping Jack
instructions: Start with feet together and arms at sides
Jump while spreading legs and raising arms overhead
Jump back to starting position
Maintain steady rhythm
tips: Classic warm-up exercise that elevates heart rate quickly

name: Jumping Lunge
instructions: Start in lunge position
Jump up explosively
Switch legs in midair
Land in lunge with opposite leg forward
tips: Builds explosive leg power and cardiovascular endurance

name: Kettlebell Around the World
instructions: Hold kettlebell in one hand at waist level
Pass kettlebell around body from hand to hand
Maintain tight core throughout
Reverse direction after desired reps
tips: Builds grip strength and core stability

name: Kettlebell Clean
instructions: Start with kettlebell on floor
Pull kettlebell up explosively
Rotate hand and catch in rack position
Lower back to starting position
tips: Focus on smooth rotation to rack position

name: Kettlebell Curl
instructions: Hold kettlebell by handle with underhand grip
Keep elbow at side
Curl kettlebell toward shoulder
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Kettlebell's unique weight distribution challenges grip and stabilizers

name: Kettlebell Goblet Squat
instructions: Hold kettlebell by horns at chest level
Squat down keeping chest up
Push elbows between knees at bottom
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Excellent for learning proper squat mechanics

name: Kettlebell Halo
instructions: Hold kettlebell upside down by horns
Circle kettlebell around head
Maintain upright posture
Reverse direction after desired reps
tips: Great for shoulder mobility and stability

name: Kettlebell High Pull
instructions: Start with kettlebell between feet
Pull kettlebell up explosively to chest height
Lead with elbows high and wide
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Generate power from hips and legs

name: Kettlebell Shoulder Press
instructions: Clean kettlebell to rack position
Press kettlebell overhead
Lock out arm at top
Lower back to rack position
tips: Keep core tight and avoid leaning back excessively

name: Kettlebell Snatch
instructions: Start with kettlebell between feet
Swing kettlebell back then explosively forward and up
Punch hand through at top catching overhead
Lower with control back to start
tips: Master kettlebell swing before attempting snatches

name: Kettlebell Swing
instructions: Start with kettlebell between feet
Hinge at hips and swing kettlebell back
Drive hips forward explosively swinging kettlebell up
Let kettlebell swing back down between legs
tips: Power comes from hip hinge, not arms - think hip thrust motion

name: Kettlebell Turkish Get Up
instructions: Lie on back holding kettlebell overhead with one arm
Follow sequence to stand up keeping kettlebell overhead
Reverse the movement to return to lying position
Maintain control throughout entire movement
tips: Master with light weight before progressing - extremely technical movement

name: Kipping Pull Up
instructions: Hang from bar and generate swing
Drive hips forward and pull simultaneously
Get chin over bar using momentum
Control descent and repeat
tips: Use full body momentum to complete more reps than strict pull-ups

name: Knee Raise Parallel Bars
instructions: Support body on parallel bars with arms extended
Bring knees up toward chest
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep shoulders stable and avoid swinging

name: Kneeling Pulldown (band)
instructions: Kneel and hold band anchored overhead
Pull band down to chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control and repeat
tips: Kneeling position increases core engagement

name: Kneeling Push Up
instructions: Start in push-up position but with knees on ground
Lower chest toward floor
Push back up to starting position
Maintain straight line from knees to head
tips: Regression that helps build strength for standard push-ups

name: L-Sit Hold
instructions: Support body on parallel bars or floor
Lift legs straight out in front forming L shape
Hold position maintaining balance
Keep shoulders depressed throughout
tips: Advanced core hold requiring significant strength

name: Landmine 180
instructions: Hold end of landmine barbell at chest
Rotate and press bar from one side to other
Keep core engaged throughout rotation
Control the movement in both directions
tips: Builds rotational power and core strength

name: Landmine Row
instructions: Straddle landmine barbell
Hinge at hips and grip end of bar
Pull bar to chest
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Unique angle provides different stimulus than traditional rows

name: Landmine Squat and Press
instructions: Hold end of landmine barbell at chest
Squat down keeping bar at chest
As you stand, press bar overhead
Lower bar to chest as you squat again
tips: Combination movement builds full body power

name: Lat Pulldown (Band)
instructions: Anchor band overhead and grip ends
Pull band down to chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control to overhead
tips: Great alternative when cable machine unavailable

name: Lat Pulldown (Cable)
instructions: Sit at lat pulldown machine and grip bar wider than shoulders
Pull bar down to upper chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together at bottom
Return with control to full arm extension
tips: Lean back slightly and pull to upper chest, not behind neck

name: Lat Pulldown (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with thighs secured under pad
Grip handles overhead
Pull handles down to chest
Return with control to starting position
tips: Focus on pulling with back muscles rather than just arms

name: Lat Pulldown - Close Grip (Cable)
instructions: Sit at lat pulldown with close grip attachment
Pull bar down to upper chest
Keep elbows close to body
Return with control to full extension
tips: Close grip emphasizes inner back and lower lats

name: Lateral Band Walks
instructions: Place resistance band around legs above or below knees
Maintain quarter squat position
Step sideways maintaining tension
Keep knees tracking over toes
tips: Excellent for hip stability and glute activation

name: Lateral Box Jump
instructions: Stand beside box
Jump laterally onto box
Land softly with both feet
Step down and repeat or alternate sides
tips: Builds lateral power and improves agility

name: Lateral Leg Raises
instructions: Lie on side with legs stacked
Raise top leg up keeping it straight
Lower with control without touching bottom leg
Complete reps then switch sides
tips: Keep toes pointing forward to maximize hip abductor engagement

name: Lateral Lunge
instructions: Stand with feet together
Step out to side into wide stance
Bend one knee while keeping other leg straight
Push off to return to standing
tips: Great for developing lateral strength and mobility

name: Lateral Raise (Band)
instructions: Stand on band holding ends at sides
Raise arms out to sides to shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Focus on leading with elbows rather than hands

name: Lateral Raise (Cable)
instructions: Stand sideways to cable with handle in far hand
Raise arm out to side to shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbow
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout movement

name: Lateral Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides
Raise arms out to sides until shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows throughout
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Avoid swinging or using momentum - strict form is key

name: Lateral Raise (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with arms against pads
Raise arms out to sides
Lift to shoulder height
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Machine provides stable position for isolated shoulder work

name: Lateral Squat
instructions: Stand in wide stance
Shift weight to one side and bend that knee
Keep other leg straight
Push back to center and alternate sides
tips: Keep chest up and ensure knee tracks over toes

name: Leg Extension (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with pad against lower shins
Extend legs to straighten knees
Squeeze quads at top
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Excellent isolation exercise for quadriceps development

name: Leg Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit in leg press with feet on platform
Release safety and lower platform by bending knees
Press through heels to extend legs
Stop just before full lockout
tips: Avoid locking knees at top to maintain constant tension

name: Leg Press Horizontal (Machine)
instructions: Sit in horizontal leg press machine
Place feet on platform shoulder-width apart
Push platform away by extending legs
Return with control to starting position
tips: Horizontal angle provides different stimulus than angled leg press

name: Leg Raise Parallel Bars
instructions: Support body on parallel bars with arms extended
Raise straight legs up to horizontal or higher
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: More challenging than knee raises due to longer lever

name: Low Cable Fly Crossovers
instructions: Stand between cables set at low position
Hold handles with arms extended low
Bring hands together at chest height
Return with control to starting position
tips: Low angle emphasizes upper chest fibers

name: Low Row (Suspension)
instructions: Hold suspension handles and lean back
Keep body straight from head to heels
Pull chest to handles
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Adjust body angle to change difficulty level

name: Lunge
instructions: Stand with feet together
Step forward into lunge position
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front heel to return to start
tips: Keep front knee aligned over ankle, not extending past toes

name: Lunge (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell across upper back
Step forward into lunge position
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front heel to return
tips: Keep torso upright and core engaged throughout movement

name: Lunge (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Step forward into lunge
Lower back knee toward floor
Drive through front heel to return to start
tips: Dumbbells provide more natural balance than barbell

name: Lying Knee Raise
instructions: Lie on back with hands under glutes
Bring knees toward chest
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control without touching floor
tips: Press lower back into floor to maximize core engagement

name: Lying Leg Curl (Machine)
instructions: Lie face down on machine with pad against lower legs
Curl legs up toward glutes
Squeeze hamstrings at top
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Keep hips pressed into pad throughout movement

name: Lying Leg Raise
instructions: Lie on back with hands under glutes
Raise straight legs up to vertical
Lower with control without touching floor
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Keep lower back pressed down to protect spine

name: Lying Neck Curls
instructions: Lie face up on bench with head hanging off edge
Place hands on forehead for resistance
Curl head up toward chest
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Start with light resistance and progress slowly

name: Lying Neck Curls (Weighted)
instructions: Lie face up on bench with head off edge
Place weight plate on forehead with towel
Curl head up toward chest
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Use very light weight and progress conservatively

name: Lying Neck Extension
instructions: Lie face down on bench with head hanging off
Place hands on back of head for resistance
Extend head up and back
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Important to balance with neck flexion exercises

name: Lying Neck Extension (Weighted)
instructions: Lie face down on bench with head off edge
Place weight plate on back of head with towel
Extend head up and back
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Progress weight very slowly to avoid neck injury

name: Meadows Rows (Barbell)
instructions: Stand perpendicular to barbell anchored at one end
Grip end of bar with one hand
Row bar up to side of torso
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Unique angle provides great lat stretch and contraction

name: Mountain Climber
instructions: Start in plank position
Bring one knee toward chest
Quickly switch legs
Continue alternating at quick pace
tips: Keep hips level and core engaged throughout

name: Muscle Up
instructions: Hang from bar with overhand grip
Pull explosively while leaning back
Transition to dip position at top of bar
Press to full lockout above bar
tips: Advanced movement requiring significant strength and technique

name: Negative Pull Up
instructions: Jump or step up to top position of pull-up
Lower body down as slowly as possible
Focus on controlling the descent
Reset to top position and repeat
tips: Excellent for building strength toward full pull-ups

name: Nordic Hamstrings Curls
instructions: Kneel with ankles secured under pad or partner
Keep body straight from knees to head
Lower torso forward as slowly as possible
Use hands to catch yourself and push back up
tips: Extremely challenging hamstring exercise - build up slowly

name: Oblique Crunch
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent
Place one ankle on opposite knee
Crunch up and rotate toward raised knee
Lower and repeat, then switch sides
tips: Focus on rotation rather than just crunching up

name: One Arm Push Up
instructions: Start in push-up position with feet wide
Place one hand behind back
Lower down on one arm
Push back up to starting position
tips: Advanced variation requiring significant strength and stability

name: Overhead Curl (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing away from high cable
Hold handle overhead with arm extended back
Curl handle forward and down
Return with control and repeat
tips: Unique angle emphasizes long head of biceps

name: Overhead Dumbbell Lunge
instructions: Hold dumbbells overhead with arms extended
Step forward into lunge
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front heel to return
tips: Overhead position increases core and shoulder stability demands

name: Overhead Plate Raise
instructions: Hold plate at arms length in front
Raise plate overhead in arc motion
Lower back down to starting position
Keep arms relatively straight throughout
tips: Great for shoulder strength and mobility

name: Overhead Press (Barbell)
instructions: Stand with barbell at shoulder height
Press bar straight overhead
Lock out arms at top
Lower with control to shoulders
tips: Keep core tight and avoid excessive back arch

name: Overhead Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand or sit with dumbbells at shoulder height
Press dumbbells straight overhead
Bring dumbbells together at top
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Dumbbells allow for more natural pressing path

name: Overhead Press (Smith Machine)
instructions: Position bench under smith machine bar
Unrack bar at shoulder height
Press bar straight up to lockout
Lower with control and re-rack
tips: Fixed path allows for maximum loading with stability

name: Overhead Squat
instructions: Hold barbell overhead with wide grip
Squat down keeping bar overhead
Maintain upright torso
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Requires excellent mobility and stability - master technique first

name: Overhead Triceps Extension (Cable)
instructions: Face away from cable with rope overhead
Extend arms forward and up
Keep upper arms stationary
Return with control and repeat
tips: Overhead position emphasizes long head of triceps

name: Partial Glute Bridge (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on back with barbell across hips
Perform small range hip thrusts
Focus on constant tension on glutes
Maintain controlled continuous movement
tips: Partial reps keep constant tension for increased muscle activation

name: Pause Squat (Barbell)
instructions: Set up barbell across upper back
Squat down to parallel
Pause for 2-3 seconds at bottom
Drive up explosively to standing
tips: Pause eliminates momentum and builds strength from bottom position

name: Pendlay Row (Barbell)
instructions: Bend over with torso parallel to floor
Pull bar explosively from floor to chest
Lower bar back to floor between reps
Reset and repeat
tips: Dead stop between reps eliminates momentum for pure power

name: Pendulum Squat (Machine)
instructions: Position yourself in pendulum squat machine
Place shoulders under pads
Squat down with controlled movement
Push through heels to return to start
tips: Unique arc path provides different stimulus than linear machines

name: Pike Pushup
instructions: Start in downward dog position with hips high
Lower head toward ground between hands
Push back up to starting position
Keep hips elevated throughout
tips: Progression toward handstand push-ups

name: Pilates
instructions: Perform series of controlled movements
Focus on core engagement throughout
Emphasize breath control
Move through exercises with precision
tips: Builds core strength, flexibility, and mind-body connection

name: Pinwheel Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbell with thumb toward body
Curl across body toward opposite shoulder
Keep elbow stationary
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Unique angle targets biceps from different direction

name: Pistol Squat
instructions: Stand on one leg with other leg extended forward
Squat down on standing leg
Keep extended leg off ground
Push through heel to stand back up
tips: Advanced unilateral movement requiring strength, balance, and mobility

name: Plank
instructions: Support body on forearms and toes
Keep body in straight line from head to heels
Engage core and avoid sagging hips
Hold position for desired time
tips: Fundamental core exercise for building stability

name: Plank Pushup
instructions: Start in forearm plank
Push up onto hands one arm at a time
Lower back to forearms one arm at a time
Alternate which arm leads
tips: Keep hips stable and avoid rotating

name: Plate Curl
instructions: Hold plate with both hands at sides
Curl plate up toward chest
Keep elbows stationary
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Grip challenges forearms while building biceps

name: Plate Front Raise
instructions: Hold plate in front of thighs
Raise plate forward to shoulder height
Keep arms relatively straight
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Use lighter weight than you think for proper form

name: Plate Press
instructions: Hold plate pressed between palms at chest
Press plate forward extending arms
Maintain pressure on plate throughout
Return to chest and repeat
tips: Squeezing plate increases inner chest activation

name: Plate Squeeze (Svend Press)
instructions: Squeeze plate between palms at chest
Press plate straight out while squeezing
Fully extend arms maintaining squeeze
Return to chest keeping pressure
tips: Constant squeeze provides intense inner chest contraction

name: Power Clean
instructions: Pull bar from floor with explosive hip extension
Catch bar on shoulders in partial squat
Stand fully upright
Lower bar to floor and repeat
tips: Focus on explosive power from hips and legs

name: Power Snatch
instructions: Pull bar from floor with wide grip
Explosively extend and drop under bar
Catch bar overhead in partial squat
Stand to full extension
tips: Requires speed, power, and mobility

name: Preacher Curl (Barbell)
instructions: Sit at preacher bench with arms over pad
Hold barbell with underhand grip
Curl weight toward shoulders
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Preacher bench isolates biceps by preventing shoulder movement

name: Preacher Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Sit at preacher bench with one arm over pad
Hold dumbbell with underhand grip
Curl weight toward shoulder
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Work one arm at a time to address imbalances

name: Preacher Curl (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with arms on pad
Grip handles with underhand grip
Curl weight toward shoulders
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Machine provides consistent resistance curve

name: Press Under
instructions: Start with bar at shoulders
Dip and drive bar up slightly
Drop quickly under bar into squat
Stand with bar overhead
tips: Teaches proper overhead receiving position for snatches

name: Pull Up
instructions: Hang from bar with overhand grip wider than shoulders
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full arm extension
Repeat for desired reps
tips: One of the best exercises for back development

name: Pull Up (Assisted)
instructions: Set assistance weight on machine
Grip bar with overhand grip
Pull up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Gradually reduce assistance to build toward unassisted pull-ups

name: Pull Up (Band)
instructions: Loop band over bar and place foot or knee in band
Grip bar with overhand grip
Pull up with band assistance
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Band provides varying assistance throughout range of motion

name: Pull Up (Weighted)
instructions: Attach weight to dip belt
Hang from bar with overhand grip
Pull up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Only add weight once you can perform multiple clean bodyweight reps

name: Pullover (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie perpendicular on bench with only upper back supported
Hold dumbbell above chest with arms extended
Lower weight back over head in arc
Pull back to starting position
tips: Great for expanding rib cage and working lats

name: Pullover (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with arms on pads overhead
Pull arms down in arc motion
Bring pads to torso level
Return with control to starting position
tips: Isolates lats with minimal bicep involvement

name: Push Press
instructions: Start with bar at shoulders
Dip down slightly
Drive up explosively pressing bar overhead
Lock out arms at top
tips: Leg drive allows you to lift more weight than strict press

name: Push Up
instructions: Start in plank position with hands shoulder-width
Lower chest toward ground
Push back up to full arm extension
Maintain straight body line throughout
tips: Fundamental upper body exercise that can be done anywhere

name: Push Up (Weighted)
instructions: Place weight plate on upper back
Perform push-ups maintaining plate position
Lower chest to ground
Push back up to starting position
tips: Progress to weighted once bodyweight push-ups become too easy

name: Push Up - Close Grip
instructions: Start in plank with hands closer than shoulder-width
Lower down keeping elbows close to body
Push back up to full extension
Maintain straight body line
tips: Narrow grip emphasizes triceps over chest

name: Rack Pull
instructions: Set barbell on rack at knee height
Grip bar and lift by extending hips
Stand fully upright
Lower with control back to rack
tips: Partial range deadlift for overloading top position

name: Rear Delt Reverse Fly (Cable)
instructions: Stand between cable stations at shoulder height
Cross arms and grip opposite handles
Pull handles out to sides
Return with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout movement

name: Rear Delt Reverse Fly (Dumbbell)
instructions: Bend forward at hips holding dumbbells
Raise arms out to sides in arc motion
Squeeze shoulder blades together at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Keep slight bend in elbows throughout movement

name: Rear Delt Reverse Fly (Machine)
instructions: Sit facing machine with chest against pad
Grip handles with arms extended forward
Pull handles back and out to sides
Return with control to starting position
tips: Important for shoulder health and posture

name: Rear Kick (Machine)
instructions: Position yourself in machine with pad against leg
Kick leg back extending at hip
Squeeze glute at top
Return with control and repeat
tips: Focus on glute contraction rather than just moving weight

name: Renegade Row (Dumbbell)
instructions: Start in plank position with hands on dumbbells
Row one dumbbell to side while stabilizing with other
Lower dumbbell back to ground
Alternate sides maintaining plank position
tips: Keep hips stable and avoid rotating during rows

name: Reverse Crunch
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent
Lift hips off ground bringing knees toward chest
Curl pelvis up toward ribcage
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Focus on using abs to curl hips up, not just lifting knees

name: Reverse Curl (Barbell)
instructions: Hold barbell with overhand grip
Keep elbows at sides
Curl weight up toward shoulders
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Overhand grip emphasizes forearms and brachialis

name: Reverse Curl (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with overhand grip
Keep elbows stationary at sides
Curl handle up toward shoulders
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Constant cable tension maximizes forearm development

name: Reverse Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells with overhand grip
Keep elbows close to sides
Curl weights toward shoulders
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Targets brachioradialis for fuller forearm development

name: Reverse Fly Single Arm (Cable)
instructions: Stand sideways to cable at shoulder height
Reach across body to grip handle
Pull handle across and back
Return with control and repeat
tips: Working one side at a time allows greater focus

name: Reverse Grip Concentration Curl
instructions: Sit with elbow braced on inner thigh
Hold dumbbell with overhand grip
Curl weight toward shoulder
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Combination of concentration and reverse grip for forearms

name: Reverse Grip Lat Pulldown (Cable)
instructions: Sit at lat pulldown with underhand grip
Pull bar down to upper chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control to full extension
tips: Underhand grip emphasizes lower lats and biceps

name: Reverse Hyperextension
instructions: Lie face down on bench with legs hanging off
Grip bench for stability
Raise legs up to parallel
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Emphasizes glutes and hamstrings with reduced spinal load

name: Reverse Lunge
instructions: Stand with feet together
Step backward into lunge position
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front heel to return
tips: Reverse lunge is often easier on knees than forward lunge

name: Reverse Lunge (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell across upper back
Step backward into lunge
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front heel to return
tips: Keep torso upright throughout movement

name: Reverse Lunge (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Step backward into lunge position
Lower back knee toward floor
Drive through front heel to return
tips: Dumbbells provide more natural balance than barbell

name: Reverse Plank
instructions: Sit with legs extended and hands behind you
Lift hips up forming straight line
Keep chest up and core engaged
Hold position for desired time
tips: Great for posterior chain and shoulder stability

name: Ring Dips
instructions: Support body on rings with arms extended
Lower body by bending elbows
Go down until shoulders below elbows
Push back up to starting position
tips: Rings add significant instability challenge

name: Ring Pull Up
instructions: Hang from rings with overhand grip
Pull body up until chest reaches rings
Lower with control to full extension
Stabilize rings throughout movement
tips: Ring instability increases difficulty and muscle activation

name: Ring Push Up
instructions: Hold rings in push-up position
Lower chest while stabilizing rings
Push back up to starting position
Keep body straight throughout
tips: Much harder than standard push-ups due to instability

name: Romanian Deadlift (Barbell)
instructions: Hold barbell at thighs with slight knee bend
Hinge at hips lowering bar down legs
Keep back flat and bar close to body
Drive hips forward to return to standing
tips: One of the best exercises for hamstring development

name: Romanian Deadlift (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides with slight knee bend
Hinge at hips lowering weights down legs
Keep back straight throughout
Drive hips forward to return upright
tips: Feel the stretch in hamstrings at bottom of movement

name: Rope Cable Curl
instructions: Stand facing cable with rope attachment at low position
Grip rope ends with neutral grip
Curl rope toward shoulders
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Rope allows for natural grip and full bicep contraction

name: Rope Straight Arm Pulldown
instructions: Stand facing cable with rope at high position
Hold rope with arms extended overhead
Pull rope down to thighs keeping arms straight
Return with control to starting position
tips: Isolates lats with minimal bicep involvement

name: Rowing Machine
instructions: Sit on rower with feet secured
Drive with legs then pull handle to chest
Extend arms then bend knees to return
Maintain steady rhythm
tips: Focus on leg drive first, then back pull for efficient rowing

name: Running
instructions: Maintain upright posture while running
Land mid-foot rather than heel
Keep arms bent at 90 degrees
Maintain consistent breathing pattern
tips: Build up distance gradually to avoid injury

name: Russian Twist (Bodyweight)
instructions: Sit with knees bent and feet off ground
Lean back slightly maintaining balance
Rotate torso side to side
Touch ground beside hips each rep
tips: Keep chest up and rotate from core, not just arms

name: Russian Twist (Weighted)
instructions: Sit with knees bent holding weight at chest
Lift feet off ground and lean back
Rotate torso touching weight to ground each side
Maintain controlled movement throughout
tips: Start with light weight and focus on rotation quality

name: Scapular Pull Ups
instructions: Hang from bar with arms extended
Depress shoulder blades pulling body up slightly
Hold briefly at top
Return to dead hang and repeat
tips: Small movement focusing on shoulder blade control

name: Seated Cable Row - Bar Grip
instructions: Sit at cable row with feet on platform
Grip bar with overhand grip
Pull bar to lower chest
Return with control to full extension
tips: Keep torso upright and squeeze shoulder blades together

name: Seated Cable Row - Bar Wide Grip
instructions: Sit at cable row with wide bar attachment
Grip bar outside shoulder width
Pull bar to upper chest
Return with control to starting position
tips: Wide grip emphasizes upper back and rear delts

name: Seated Cable Row - V Grip (Cable)
instructions: Sit at cable row with V-grip attachment
Pull handle to lower chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together at end
Return with control to full extension
tips: V-grip provides neutral hand position for reduced wrist stress

name: Seated Calf Raise
instructions: Sit at machine with knees under pad
Place balls of feet on platform
Raise heels as high as possible
Lower heels below platform level
tips: Seated position emphasizes soleus muscle of calves

name: Seated Chest Flys (Cable)
instructions: Sit on bench between cables at shoulder height
Hold handles with arms extended to sides
Bring handles together in front of chest
Return with control to starting position
tips: Seated position provides stability for focused chest work

name: Seated Dip Machine
instructions: Sit at machine with hands on handles
Press handles down to extend arms
Return with control to starting position
Keep elbows back throughout
tips: Machine provides stable platform for focused triceps work

name: Seated Incline Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Sit on incline bench with dumbbells hanging
Curl weights toward shoulders
Keep upper arms stationary
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Incline provides greater stretch on biceps at bottom

name: Seated Lateral Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions: Sit on bench holding dumbbells at sides
Raise arms out to sides to shoulder height
Keep slight bend in elbows
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Seated position eliminates momentum for stricter form

name: Seated Leg Curl (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with pad against lower legs
Curl legs down by bending knees
Squeeze hamstrings at bottom
Return with control to starting position
tips: Alternative angle to lying leg curls for hamstring development

name: Seated Overhead Press (Barbell)
instructions: Sit on bench with barbell at shoulder height
Press bar straight overhead
Lock out arms at top
Lower with control to shoulders
tips: Seated position provides back support for heavier pressing

name: Seated Overhead Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Sit on bench with dumbbells at shoulder height
Press dumbbells straight overhead
Bring together at top
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Allow natural arc of motion for shoulder health

name: Seated Palms Up Wrist Curl
instructions: Sit with forearms on thighs, palms up holding weight
Curl wrists up
Lower wrists down allowing full extension
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Focus on full range of motion for forearm development

name: Seated Row (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with chest against pad
Grip handles and pull back to torso
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control to full extension
tips: Keep chest pressed to pad throughout movement

name: Seated Shoulder Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with handles at shoulder height
Press handles straight up overhead
Extend arms fully at top
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Machine provides stable path for shoulder pressing

name: Seated Triceps Press
instructions: Sit holding dumbbell overhead with both hands
Lower weight behind head by bending elbows
Keep upper arms stationary
Press back up to starting position
tips: Overhead position emphasizes long head of triceps

name: Seated Wrist Extension (Barbell)
instructions: Sit with forearms on thighs, palms down holding bar
Extend wrists upward
Lower wrists down for full range
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Targets extensor muscles on top of forearms

name: Shoulder Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand or sit with dumbbells at shoulder height
Press dumbbells overhead
Extend arms fully at top
Lower with control to shoulders
tips: Core must work harder when standing vs seated

name: Shoulder Press (Machine Plates)
instructions: Sit at plate-loaded shoulder press machine
Grip handles at shoulder height
Press handles overhead
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Plate-loaded machines often feel more natural than stack machines

name: Shoulder Taps
instructions: Start in plank position
Tap one hand to opposite shoulder
Return to plank and alternate sides
Keep hips stable throughout
tips: Focus on minimizing hip rotation during taps

name: Shrug (Barbell)
instructions: Stand holding barbell at thighs
Shrug shoulders straight up toward ears
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Avoid rolling shoulders - move straight up and down

name: Shrug (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with bar at low position
Hold bar at thighs
Shrug shoulders up toward ears
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout movement

name: Shrug (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbells at sides
Shrug shoulders straight up
Hold briefly at top
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Dumbbells allow for natural scapular movement

name: Shrug (Machine)
instructions: Stand in shrug machine with handles at sides
