Shrug shoulders up toward ears
Hold at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Machine provides stable position for heavy loading

name: Shrug (Smith Machine)
instructions: Stand under smith machine bar
Grip bar and unrack
Shrug shoulders straight up
Lower with control and re-rack
tips: Fixed path allows for maximum loading safely

name: Side Bend
instructions: Stand with hands behind head
Bend torso to one side
Return to center
Alternate sides
tips: Targets obliques for lateral core strength

name: Side Bend (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand holding dumbbell in one hand
Bend away from weight side
Return to upright position
Complete reps then switch sides
tips: Control the movement and avoid momentum

name: Side Plank
instructions: Lie on side supported on forearm and feet
Lift hips to form straight line
Hold position engaging obliques
Switch sides after desired time
tips: Keep hips stacked and body in straight line

name: Single Arm Cable Crossover
instructions: Stand sideways to high cable
Grip handle and pull across body
Squeeze chest at end position
Return with control and repeat
tips: Working one side allows greater focus and addresses imbalances

name: Single Arm Cable Row
instructions: Stand facing cable with handle in one hand
Pull handle to side of torso
Squeeze shoulder blade back
Return with control and repeat
tips: Single arm work helps correct strength imbalances

name: Single Arm Curl (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with handle at low position
Curl handle toward shoulder with one arm
Keep elbow stationary
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Constant tension from cable maximizes bicep engagement

name: Single Arm Landmine Press (Barbell)
instructions: Hold end of landmine barbell at shoulder
Press weight up and forward
Extend arm fully at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Unilateral loading increases core stability demands

name: Single Arm Lat Pulldown
instructions: Sit at lat pulldown with one handle
Pull handle down to shoulder
Squeeze lat at bottom
Return with control to full extension
tips: Working one side at a time helps address imbalances

name: Single Arm Lateral Raise (Cable)
instructions: Stand sideways to cable at low position
Grip handle and raise arm out to side
Lift to shoulder height
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Cable angle provides unique resistance curve

name: Single Arm Tricep Extension (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand or sit holding dumbbell overhead
Lower weight behind head by bending elbow
Keep upper arm stationary
Press back up and repeat
tips: Work each arm individually to address imbalances

name: Single Arm Triceps Pushdown (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with one hand on handle
Push handle down by extending elbow
Keep upper arm stationary
Return with control and repeat
tips: Unilateral work ensures balanced triceps development

name: Single Leg Extensions
instructions: Sit at leg extension machine
Extend one leg at a time
Squeeze quad at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Single leg work helps identify and correct strength imbalances

name: Single Leg Glute Bridge
instructions: Lie on back with one knee bent, other leg extended
Drive through heel to lift hips
Squeeze glute at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Single leg increases difficulty and addresses imbalances

name: Single Leg Hip Thrust
instructions: Position upper back on bench with one foot on ground
Extend other leg straight
Thrust hips up squeezing glute
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Advanced unilateral glute exercise

name: Single Leg Hip Thrust (Dumbbell)
instructions: Position upper back on bench with dumbbell on hip
One foot on ground, other leg extended
Thrust hips up while holding dumbbell
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Add weight once bodyweight version becomes too easy

name: Single Leg Press (Machine)
instructions: Sit in leg press with one foot on platform
Press platform away extending leg
Return with control
Complete reps then switch legs
tips: Use significantly less weight than bilateral leg press

name: Single Leg Romanian Deadlift (Barbell)
instructions: Stand on one leg holding barbell
Hinge at hip lowering bar down standing leg
Extend other leg back for balance
Return to standing and repeat
tips: Challenges balance while building hamstring strength

name: Single Leg Romanian Deadlift (Dumbbell)
instructions: Stand on one leg holding dumbbells
Hinge at hip lowering weights
Extend free leg behind for balance
Return to standing position
tips: Excellent for hamstring development and balance

name: Single Leg Standing Calf Raise
instructions: Stand on one leg with ball of foot on edge
Rise up onto toes as high as possible
Lower heel below starting position
Complete reps then switch legs
tips: Bodyweight single leg trains calves effectively

name: Single Leg Standing Calf Raise (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell on back, stand on one leg
Ball of foot on edge
Rise up onto toes
Lower heel below platform
tips: Advanced variation requiring significant calf strength

name: Single Leg Standing Calf Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbell in one hand, stand on same side leg
Ball of foot on edge
Rise up onto toes
Lower heel below platform
tips: Dumbbell provides manageable resistance for single leg work

name: Single Leg Standing Calf Raise (Machine)
instructions: Position one shoulder under pad of standing calf machine
Stand on one leg with ball of foot on platform
Rise up onto toes
Lower heel below platform
tips: Machine allows for progressive overload safely

name: Sissy Squat (Weighted)
instructions: Hold weight to chest and lean back
Bend knees keeping torso and thighs aligned
Lower down while leaning back
Push through toes to return up
tips: Advanced quad isolation exercise requiring good knee health

name: Sit Up
instructions: Lie on back with knees bent
Sit up bringing torso to thighs
Lower back down with control
Repeat for desired reps
tips: More hip flexor involvement than crunches

name: Sit Up (Weighted)
instructions: Lie on back holding weight on chest
Sit up bringing torso to thighs
Keep weight secure throughout
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Add weight progressively as bodyweight becomes easy

name: Skating
instructions: Push off with one leg while gliding on other
Maintain low athletic position
Alternate legs in skating motion
Use arms for balance and momentum
tips: Great cardio that builds leg strength and balance

name: Skiing
instructions: Maintain athletic stance with knees bent
Shift weight and turn skis to control speed
Use poles for balance and propulsion
Engage core for stability
tips: Excellent full body workout combining strength and cardio

name: Skullcrusher (Barbell)
instructions: Lie on bench holding barbell above chest
Lower bar to forehead by bending elbows
Keep upper arms stationary
Press back up to starting position
tips: Control the weight carefully near your head

name: Skullcrusher (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on bench with dumbbells above chest
Lower dumbbells to sides of head
Keep upper arms stationary
Press back up to starting position
tips: Dumbbells allow for more natural arm path

name: Sled Push
instructions: Load sled with weight plates
Grip handles and lean into sled
Drive through legs to push sled forward
Maintain low powerful position
tips: Excellent conditioning exercise that builds leg power

name: Snatch
instructions: Pull bar from floor with wide grip
Explosively extend and drop under bar
Catch overhead in full squat
Stand to complete lift
tips: Most technical Olympic lift requiring significant practice

name: Snowboarding
instructions: Maintain bent knees and centered position
Shift weight to control board
Use core for rotation and balance
Engage legs for turns and jumps
tips: Builds leg strength, balance, and core stability

name: Spider Curl (Barbell)
instructions: Lie face down on incline bench
Hold barbell with arms hanging straight
Curl weight up to shoulders
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Chest support eliminates momentum for strict bicep isolation

name: Spider Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie face down on incline bench
Hold dumbbells with arms hanging straight
Curl weights toward shoulders
Lower with control to full extension
tips: Gravity angle provides unique resistance curve

name: Spiderman
instructions: Start in plank position
Bring knee to same side elbow
Return to plank
Alternate sides
tips: Combines core stability with hip mobility

name: Spinning
instructions: Adjust bike to proper fit
Maintain steady cadence
Vary resistance throughout workout
Follow instructor or programmed routine
tips: High-intensity cycling workout great for leg endurance

name: Split Jerk
instructions: Start with bar on front shoulders
Dip and drive bar overhead
Split legs front and back under bar
Stand with feet together to finish
tips: Most common jerk variation in Olympic weightlifting

name: Split Squat (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells and step into split stance
Lower back knee toward ground
Keep front knee over ankle
Push through front heel to return up
tips: Similar to lunge but back foot stays planted

name: Sprints
instructions: Accelerate to maximum speed
Maintain proper running form
Drive knees high and pump arms
Decelerate gradually after sprint distance
tips: Excellent for building speed and explosive power

name: Squat (Band)
instructions: Stand on band holding ends at shoulders
Squat down keeping chest up
Lower until thighs parallel to ground
Push through heels to stand
tips: Band provides accommodating resistance throughout movement

name: Squat (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell across upper back
Feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down keeping chest up
Drive through heels to stand
tips: King of leg exercises for building overall lower body strength

name: Squat (Bodyweight)
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down keeping chest up
Lower until thighs parallel or below
Push through heels to stand
tips: Master bodyweight form before adding external load

name: Squat (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides or shoulders
Feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down keeping chest up
Drive through heels to return up
tips: Dumbbells provide alternative to barbell squatting

name: Squat (Machine)
instructions: Position shoulders under pads
Feet on platform shoulder-width
Squat down with controlled movement
Push through heels to return
tips: Machine provides stability for maximum loading

name: Squat (Smith Machine)
instructions: Position bar on upper back
Unrack and squat down
Lower until thighs parallel
Drive up to standing
tips: Fixed bar path removes stabilization requirement

name: Squat (Suspension)
instructions: Hold suspension handles for support
Squat down using handles for balance
Lower as deep as comfortable
Push through heels to stand
tips: Great for learning proper squat pattern

name: Squat Row
instructions: Hold cable handles and sit back into squat
Stand while pulling handles to chest
Combine squat drive with row
Return to starting position
tips: Compound movement combining lower and upper body

name: Stair Machine (Floors)
instructions: Step onto machine and grip handles lightly
Maintain steady stepping pace
Keep upright posture
Avoid leaning heavily on handles
tips: Excellent cardio that builds leg endurance

name: Stair Machine (Steps)
instructions: Step onto machine and begin stepping motion
Maintain consistent pace
Use handles for light balance only
Keep good posture throughout
tips: Low-impact alternative to running that builds legs

name: Standing Cable Glute Kickbacks
instructions: Attach ankle cuff to low cable
Face machine holding on for support
Kick leg back extending at hip
Return with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension on glutes

name: Standing Calf Raise
instructions: Stand with balls of feet on edge
Rise up onto toes as high as possible
Hold briefly at top
Lower heels below starting position
tips: Can be done anywhere for calf development

name: Standing Calf Raise (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell on upper back
Stand with balls of feet on edge
Rise up onto toes
Lower heels below platform
tips: Barbell allows for progressive overload

name: Standing Calf Raise (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Stand with balls of feet on edge
Rise up onto toes
Lower heels below starting position
tips: Dumbbells provide convenient resistance

name: Standing Calf Raise (Machine)
instructions: Position shoulders under pads
Stand with balls of feet on platform
Rise up onto toes as high as possible
Lower heels below platform level
tips: Machine provides stable platform for heavy loading

name: Standing Calf Raise (Smith)
instructions: Position bar on upper back in smith machine
Stand with balls of feet on platform
Rise up onto toes
Lower heels below platform
tips: Smith machine provides stability for maximum weight

name: Standing Leg Curls
instructions: Stand at machine with pad behind ankle
Curl leg up by bending knee
Squeeze hamstring at top
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Standing variation provides different stimulus than lying version

name: Standing Military Press (Barbell)
instructions: Stand with barbell at shoulder height
Press bar straight overhead
Lock out arms at top
Lower with control to shoulders
tips: Standing requires more core stability than seated

name: Step Up
instructions: Stand facing box or platform
Step up with one foot
Drive through heel to stand on box
Step down and alternate or complete set
tips: Avoid pushing off back foot - let front leg do all the work

name: Sternum Pull up (Gironda)
instructions: Hang from bar with overhand grip
Pull up bringing sternum to bar
Lean back as you pull
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Advanced pull-up variation for maximum back development

name: Straight Arm Lat Pulldown (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with bar at high position
Hold bar with arms extended overhead
Pull bar down to thighs keeping arms straight
Return with control to starting position
tips: Isolates lats by keeping arms straight throughout

name: Straight Leg Deadlift
instructions: Hold barbell with legs nearly straight
Hinge at hips lowering bar down legs
Keep back flat throughout
Drive hips forward to return standing
tips: Similar to Romanian deadlift with straighter legs

name: Stretching
instructions: Move through various stretching positions
Hold each stretch for 20-30 seconds
Breathe deeply throughout
Focus on major muscle groups
tips: Essential for maintaining flexibility and preventing injury

name: Sumo Deadlift
instructions: Stand with wide stance, toes pointed out
Grip bar inside legs
Lift by extending hips and knees
Stand fully upright then lower
tips: Wide stance emphasizes quads and glutes more than conventional

name: Sumo Squat
instructions: Stand in wide stance with toes pointed out
Squat down keeping chest up
Lower until thighs parallel
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Wide stance emphasizes inner thighs and glutes

name: Sumo Squat (Barbell)
instructions: Rest barbell on upper back
Stand in wide stance, toes out
Squat down keeping torso upright
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Wider stance allows for more upright torso

name: Sumo Squat (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbell vertically at arms length
Stand in wide stance with toes out
Squat down keeping chest up
Drive through heels to return up
tips: Single dumbbell works well for sumo stance

name: Sumo Squat (Kettlebell)
instructions: Hold kettlebell with both hands
Stand in wide stance, toes out
Squat down between legs
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Kettlebell shape works perfectly for sumo squats

name: Superman
instructions: Lie face down with arms extended overhead
Simultaneously lift arms, chest, and legs off ground
Hold briefly in extended position
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Great for strengthening entire posterior chain

name: Swimming
instructions: Choose swimming stroke (freestyle, breaststroke, etc.)
Maintain proper technique throughout
Breathe rhythmically
Swim for desired distance or duration
tips: Low-impact full body workout excellent for all fitness levels

name: T Bar Row
instructions: Straddle T-bar and grip handles
Hinge at hips with flat back
Pull bar to chest
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Excellent for building back thickness

name: Thruster (Barbell)
instructions: Hold barbell at front shoulders
Squat down then drive up explosively
As you stand, press bar overhead
Lower bar to shoulders and repeat
tips: Combines front squat and push press for full body conditioning

name: Thruster (Kettlebell)
instructions: Hold kettlebells at shoulders
Squat down keeping chest up
Drive up and press kettlebells overhead
Lower and repeat
tips: Kettlebell version allows for more natural movement

name: Toe Touch
instructions: Stand with feet together
Bend forward reaching toward toes
Keep legs straight
Hold stretch at comfortable point
tips: Classic hamstring flexibility exercise

name: Toes to Bar
instructions: Hang from pull-up bar
Raise legs up bringing toes to bar
Lower with control to hanging position
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Advanced core exercise requiring significant strength

name: Torso Rotation
instructions: Sit at torso rotation machine
Grip handles and rotate torso to one side
Return to center with control
Complete reps then switch sides
tips: Isolates obliques for rotational core strength

name: Treadmill
instructions: Step onto treadmill and start at walking pace
Gradually increase speed to desired intensity
Maintain natural running or walking form
Adjust incline for added difficulty
tips: Versatile cardio option for all fitness levels

name: Triceps Dip
instructions: Grip dip bars with arms extended
Keep body upright and lower down
Go until upper arms parallel to ground
Push back up to starting position
tips: Stay upright to emphasize triceps over chest

name: Triceps Dip (Assisted)
instructions: Set assistance weight on machine
Grip handles and place knees on pad
Lower body by bending elbows
Push back up to full extension
tips: Build strength toward unassisted triceps dips

name: Triceps Dip (Weighted)
instructions: Attach weight to dip belt
Grip dip bars with arms extended
Lower body staying upright
Push back up to starting position
tips: Add weight only after mastering bodyweight dips

name: Triceps Extension (Barbell)
instructions: Stand or sit holding barbell overhead
Lower bar behind head by bending elbows
Keep upper arms stationary
Press back up to starting position
tips: Overhead position maximally stretches triceps

name: Triceps Extension (Cable)
instructions: Face away from cable with rope overhead
Extend arms forward and up
Keep upper arms stationary
Return with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout range

name: Triceps Extension (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbell overhead with both hands
Lower weight behind head
Keep upper arms vertical
Press back up to overhead position
tips: Great for building tricep mass and strength

name: Triceps Extension (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine with arms positioned
Extend arms by straightening elbows
Keep upper arms against pads
Return with control to starting position
tips: Machine provides stable platform for isolation

name: Triceps Extension (Suspension)
instructions: Face away from anchor with handles overhead
Lean forward with arms extended
Bend elbows lowering head forward
Press back to starting position
tips: Bodyweight variation that challenges stability

name: Triceps Kickback (Cable)
instructions: Hinge forward holding cable handle
Keep upper arm parallel to ground
Extend elbow pushing handle back
Return with control and repeat
tips: Focus on squeezing tricep at full extension

name: Triceps Kickback (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hinge forward with dumbbell in hand
Keep upper arm parallel to torso
Extend elbow pressing weight back
Return to 90-degree bend and repeat
tips: Keep upper arm stationary throughout movement

name: Triceps Pressdown
instructions: Stand facing cable with bar at chest height
Press bar down by extending elbows
Keep upper arms at sides
Return with control to starting position
tips: Classic triceps isolation exercise

name: Triceps Pushdown
instructions: Face cable with straight bar at high position
Push bar down extending elbows fully
Keep upper arms stationary at sides
Return with control and repeat
tips: Avoid leaning forward - keep torso upright

name: Triceps Rope Pushdown
instructions: Stand facing cable with rope attachment
Push rope down extending elbows
Split rope at bottom for extra contraction
Return with control to starting position
tips: Rope allows for natural grip and full tricep contraction

name: Upright Row (Barbell)
instructions: Hold barbell at thighs with close grip
Pull bar up to chest height
Lead with elbows high and wide
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Use moderate grip width to protect shoulders

name: Upright Row (Cable)
instructions: Stand facing cable with bar at low position
Pull bar up to chest height
Keep elbows high and wide
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Cable provides constant tension throughout movement

name: Upright Row (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at thighs
Pull weights up to chest height
Lead with elbows high
Lower with control to starting position
tips: Dumbbells allow for more natural arm path

name: V Up
instructions: Lie flat with arms extended overhead
Simultaneously raise legs and torso
Touch hands to feet forming V shape
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Advanced core exercise requiring significant strength

name: Vertical Traction (Machine)
instructions: Sit at machine and grip handles overhead
Pull handles down to chest
Squeeze shoulder blades together
Return with control to full extension
tips: Similar to lat pulldown with different machine design

name: Waiter Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbell vertically with both hands under top plate
Curl weight up like carrying a tray
Keep palms facing up throughout
Lower with control and repeat
tips: Unique grip emphasizes bicep peak development

name: Walking
instructions: Maintain upright posture while walking
Swing arms naturally
Land heel to toe with each step
Maintain steady comfortable pace
tips: Low-impact cardio suitable for all fitness levels

name: Walking Lunge
instructions: Step forward into lunge position
Lower back knee toward ground
Push through front heel and step forward with back leg
Continue alternating legs moving forward
tips: Great for building functional leg strength and balance

name: Walking Lunge (Dumbbell)
instructions: Hold dumbbells at sides
Step forward into lunge
Lower back knee toward floor
Step forward with back leg and continue
tips: Add weight progressively as movement becomes easier

name: Wall Ball
instructions: Hold medicine ball at chest facing wall
Squat down then explosively stand
Throw ball up to target on wall
Catch ball and immediately squat again
tips: Full body conditioning exercise combining squat and press

name: Wall Sit
instructions: Lean back against wall and slide down
Position thighs parallel to ground
Keep back flat against wall
Hold position for desired time
tips: Isometric exercise that builds quad endurance

name: Warm Up
instructions: Perform light cardio to elevate heart rate
Include dynamic stretches and mobility work
Gradually increase intensity
Prepare body for main workout
tips: Always warm up before training to prevent injury and improve performance

name: Wide Pull Up
instructions: Grip bar wider than shoulder width
Pull body up until chin clears bar
Lower with control to full extension
Repeat for desired reps
tips: Wide grip emphasizes outer lats

name: Wide-Elbow Triceps Press (Dumbbell)
instructions: Lie on bench holding dumbbells above chest
Lower dumbbells with elbows flared out
Press back up to starting position
Keep wider elbow angle throughout
tips: Wide elbow position emphasizes long head of triceps

name: Wrist Roller
instructions: Hold wrist roller with arms extended forward
Roll weight up by rotating wrists
Continue until weight reaches roller
Reverse motion to lower weight
tips: Excellent for building forearm strength and endurance

name: Yoga
instructions: Flow through various yoga poses
Focus on breath and movement connection
Hold poses for desired duration
Emphasize flexibility and mindfulness
tips: Improves flexibility, balance, strength, and mental well-being

name: Zercher Squat
instructions: Hold barbell in crook of elbows
Stand with feet shoulder-width apart
Squat down keeping chest up
Drive through heels to stand
tips: Unique bar position emphasizes core and upper back

name: Zottman Curl (Dumbbell)
instructions: Curl dumbbells with underhand grip
At top, rotate to overhand grip
Lower with overhand grip
Rotate back to underhand at bottom
tips: Combines standard and reverse curl for complete arm development
